turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Ukrainian minority in Poland.
turn.1: What is the most important fact in the section on The Committee for the Release of Ukrainians from Poland?
turn.2: The Committee's interventions led to the release of 85,000 ethnic Ukrainian prisoners-of-war (presumably, from the Polish military) who were captured during the German-Polish conflict.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It was unable, however, to intervene in the brutal treatment of Ukrainian prisoners who had fought in the Soviet military.
turn.5: Did this put an end to the ethnic tensions?
turn.6: When the Germans began to kill Ukrainian peasants in the Zamosc region for alleged resistance, Kubiyovych's protest to Hans Frank was able to halt that slaughter.
turn.7: What other programs did the Committee for the Release of Ukrainians in Poland sponsor?
turn.8: The Committee was also able to build student residences housing 7,000 students, provided scholarships worth 1.35 million zlotys, and organized over 100 youth groups, camps and sports clubs.
turn.9: Did they do anything else to help the Ukrainians?
turn.10: A Ukrainian Publishing House was established in Cracow.
turn.11: What was the Ukrainian Publishing House?
turn.12: It published numerous Ukrainian works and textbooks.
